title.narrative: Technical and financial support of trained radio for the production of content in Niger

description.narrative: As Results. - 26 productions (13 magazines and 13 debates) by 14 radio stations. - Community Radios have regularly solicited listening club members as resource persons in magazines and / or debates - 150 people involved in magazines and debates, about 23% were local elected representatives and 17.27% were religious. - Local radio stations have given a priority to the violation of women's human rights, like the school drop-out, forced marriages in their locality rather than the debate about women's place in local affairs. A public debate on the role of women in local governance could contribute to the fight against violence experienced by women in their respective localities

The 14 local radio stations trained during the first quarter were expected to continue to produce magazines and debates on women's rights. Under the technical supervision of RACOM, the national community radio umbrella association, 28 productions were expected, 14 magazines and 14 debates.
